entry.title: Discussion related to pull 349 and pull 319 (escrow transactions)
entry.summary: The context is an email conversation between two individuals discussing the implementation of a patch for Bitcoin. The main point of discussion is how to handle non-standard transactions and the importance of propagation in mining them. The IsStandard part of the patch is seen as uncontroversial and can be implemented quickly, while the full escrow feature set will require further testing and bug fixes. The suggestion is made to split the patch into two pull requests, one for the IsStandard change and another for the full escrow feature set, so that the network can handle the transactions when the escrow patch is fully implemented. The conversation also touches on the issue of code optimization and producing the shortest possible sequence of CScript.operator values.
